JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Georg Jensen A/S is looking for a service-minded and structured Supply Chain Planner to work at our beautiful HQ in Frederiksberg, Copenhagen. You will be a part of the Global Supply Chain team with focus on structure, entrepreneurship and with rich opportunity for professional development.

The role
As a Supply Chain Planner, you are responsible for all purchasing and planning for your specific product category. The role entails many different planning activities; thus, it is important that you are self-driven and can manage own tasks. To become a success, a strong analytical-/creative problem solver mindset and confidence in presenting new ideas to different business stakeholders is needed.
The potential for the role is great, and you will work with full attention and back up from the Supply Chain management team.

What we offer
We offer an exciting position in a global company with a strong brand and a culture built on a deep and rich heritage of Danish design and craftsmanship. Our work environment is positive and dynamic with highly qualified colleagues in an international atmosphere. You will have great opportunity to influence the development and the nature of the position as well as create value for colleagues and business partners worldwide.

Your key responsibilities:
  • Create and maintain purchase orders and/or works orders, based on both demand forecasts, customer orders, stock levels, MOQs, and other planning parameters
  • Operations Planning – plan what is produced and when it is delivered, in conjunction with forecasted demands from the sales organization
  • Identify supply gaps and review stock targets
  • Responsible for supply order schedule by balancing service level, delivery time, cost, and sustainability
  • Ensure new Product Development launched as per “launch-schedule”
  • Identify and implement best practices in the Supply Chain Planning operations
  • Create and maintain your master data on raw materials, packaging, finished goods, bills of material, cost pricing (incl. MOQ, safety stock, lead times, NPD/discontinued etc.)
     
Your profile
Robust and curious to take on complex challenges. You have a high energy level with a can-do attitude and are result oriented. The candidate has 4+ years of solid experience working within Supply Planning. It will be an advantage if you have a bachelor’s degree in SCM, Engineering, Economics, International Business or similar.

The ideal candidate has the following competences
  • You are structured and service minded
  • Demonstrated experience with Microsoft Dynamics AXAPTA (Planning/Purchasing)
  • You have analytical mindset and practical experience working with data         
  • Strong understanding of supply chain management and E2E logistics
  • Strong Excel and Power BI skills
  • High attention to detail and sense of ownership gives you the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
  • Business proficiency in English, both spoken and written – Danish proficiency is an advantage
Resumé
Only resumes received through this link will be taken into consideration. It must be submitted no later than May 17, 2022. We will be performing interviews ongoing in the process and look to fill the position as soon as possible. We look forward to hearing from you.

Contact
For more information about the position, please contact to Peter Shin, Head of Supply Chain at peter.shin@georgjensen.com. We also recommend you visiting our website at www.georgjensen.com.

Place of work:
Georg Jensen Head Quarters, Søndre Fasanvej 7, 2000 Frederiksberg

Georg Jensen is a Danish design house renowned for its timeless Danish aesthetics, superior craftsmanship and visionary collaborations with leading artists and designers. Founded in Copenhagen in 1904 by master silversmith Georg Jensen, the company creates products ranging from jewellery, watches and homeware to silver hollowware and Christmas Collectables.
We pride ourselves on our more than 1.200 highly skilled, service minded and passionate employees, stationed both at our Headquarter in Copenhagen, Denmark and throughout our global presence with 10 international subsidiaries, representing close to 100 stores and 1600 wholesale accounts globally.
